name: Mussorgsky
text:
Mussorgsky
Mussorgsky was a composer. His work included the largely forgotten opera, Treaty of Vladivostok.
Behind the scenes
Modest Mussorgsky (March 9, 1839 – March 16, 1881) was a Russian composer, known for a high degree of innovation in Russian music during the romantic period, often eschewing established conventions to achieve a unique Russian musical identity.
